com.mindfusion.scheduling.model

Class ValidateOccurrenceEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.EventObject
      • com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.ValidateOccurrenceEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ValidateOccurrenceEvent
extends java.util.EventObject
    Contains the arguments passed to handlers of the RecurrenceListener.validateOccurrence(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.ValidateOccurrenceEvent) event.
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • getItem

        public Item getItem()
        Description copied from class: ValidateOccurrenceEvent
        Gets a reference to the occurrence being checked for validity.

        You can set various properties of this instance without fear that it will become recurrence exception. For example, you can modify the start and/or end time of the item in order to ensure that the item will not appear on weekend days.

        Returns:
        An instance of the Item class specifying the occurrence for which the event is raised.

      • getRecurrenceIndex

        public int getRecurrenceIndex()
        Description copied from class: ValidateOccurrenceEvent
        Gets the zero-based index of the occurrence being validated.

        At the time the item is being validated, it is still not marked as occurrence and its Item.getOccurrenceIndex() property returns -1. Therefore you need to use this property to obtain the actual recurrence index of the item. This is done to allow you to change any of the item's properties without forcing it to become an exception.

        Returns:
        A non-negative integer value.

      • getIgnore

        public boolean getIgnore()
        Description copied from class: ValidateOccurrenceEvent
        Gets a value indicating whether this occurrence should be ignored in the pattern.

        You can use this property to filter out occurrences of the pattern, which do not meet certain criteria. For example, you can remove all occurrences on weekend days.

        Returns:
        true, to prevent this occurrence from appearing in the recurrence pattern; otherwise, false. The default is false.

      • setIgnore

        public void setIgnore(boolean value)
        Description copied from class: ValidateOccurrenceEvent
        Sets a value indicating whether this occurrence should be ignored in the pattern.

        You can use this property to filter out occurrences of the pattern, which do not meet certain criteria. For example, you can remove all occurrences on weekend days.

        Parameters:
        value - true, to prevent this occurrence from appearing in the recurrence pattern; otherwise, false. The default is false.
